content.body: interesting that someone noticed... https://github.com/denoland/deno/issues/25275. i think it's only incidental that it works in nodejs because node happened to implement module loading in js where promise hooks preserved the context.
We’ve discussed this before, and I think we decided that module evaluation always happens in a clean context?
Ie, Deno’s behavior now is correct, and this is an intentional difference from ALS.
